item.content:
In this post, I will introduce the key-value store concept and compare the features of some of the well known of this kind of databases. In its essence, a key-value store can be reduced to a database containing pairs of data in the form of {key:value}. To a key, a value is associated. Let’s take some examples:

  • “John”:"+123456789"
  • “12-34-5678”:“Jane’s birth date”

Although the notion is quite simple to grasp, implementing a key-value store, not so much.

Let’s delve into some of most used and well known key-value store:
